episodeTitle: A Mysterious Boy with a Horn and Robin's Deduction!
episodeTitleJapanese: 笛を抱いた謎の少年とロビンの推理！
episodeTitleRomanized: Fue o daita nazo no shōnen to Robin no suiri!
description: Robin deduces that only those who were sleeping lost their memories. The crew recalls the mysterious boy who played a horn the previous night. When Drim appears on the Going Merry, Luffy confronts him, and the horn's blue dust partially restores Luffy's memory. The episode features emotional flashbacks to Zoro's promise with Kuina and Nami's traumatic past with the Arlong Pirates.

events.title: Robin's Deduction About the Memory Loss
events.description: Robin, the only crew member who retained her memories, deduces that only those who were sleeping when the mysterious sound occurred lost their memories. This revelation helps the crew understand the nature of their affliction.
events.significance: Demonstrates Robin's analytical abilities and provides the first major clue toward solving the memory mystery. This establishes the pattern that will lead to identifying Noko's ability.

quotes.text: Only those who were sleeping lost their memories. I was awake reading, which is why I still remember everything.
quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin explaining her theory about the memory loss pattern

events.title: Flashback: Zoro's Promise to Kuina
events.description: In a poignant flashback sequence, Zoro recalls his childhood promise to Kuina that one of them would become the world's greatest swordsman. This memory surfaces as the crew tries to piece together their identities.
events.significance: Reinforces Zoro's core motivation and character development. Even without his conscious memories, this promise remains deeply embedded in his psyche, showing how fundamental it is to his identity.

quotes.text: One of us will become the world's greatest swordsman!
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Young Zoro making his promise to Kuina

events.title: Flashback: Nami's Trauma with the Arlong Pirates
events.description: Nami experiences painful flashback memories of her time under Arlong's control, including the forced tattooing and her suffering at Arlong Park. These traumatic memories resurface despite her amnesia.
events.significance: Highlights how deeply traumatic experiences are ingrained in memory, even when conscious recall is lost. Shows that Nami's pain and subsequent liberation by Luffy are core to her identity and connection to the crew.

events.title: The Crew Recalls the Mysterious Boy
events.description: The Straw Hat crew collectively remembers seeing a mysterious boy playing a flute-like instrument the night before they lost their memories. This shared recollection gives them a target to investigate.
events.significance: Pivotal moment that shifts the crew from confusion to having a concrete lead. Shows the crew's ability to work together and piece together clues even in their compromised state.

events.title: Drim Appears on the Going Merry
events.description: The mysterious boy, Drim, appears on the deck of the Going Merry at night, carrying his seahorse horn. The crew discovers him and realizes he's the one responsible for their memory loss.
events.significance: First direct confrontation with the arc's antagonist. This encounter sets up the central conflict that will drive the remaining episodes of the Ocean's Dream Arc.

events.title: Luffy Confronts Drim
events.description: Luffy immediately attacks Drim upon discovering him on the ship, demanding answers about their stolen memories. Drim attempts to use Noko's horn against Luffy but the rubber man's aggressive approach disrupts his plans.
events.significance: Showcases Luffy's protective nature toward his crew and his direct approach to threats. Even without full memories, Luffy's instinct is to fight for his nakama.

events.title: Noko's Memory Restoration Effect
events.description: During the confrontation, Noko's horn emits blue, sparkling dust that flows into Luffy's mouth. This exposure to the horn while Luffy is awake has the opposite effect, partially restoring some of his memories instead of stealing them.
events.significance: Reveals that Noko's power can work in reverse, providing hope for memory restoration. This discovery is crucial for the eventual resolution of the arc and demonstrates the conditional nature of the seahorse's ability.

events.title: Drim Escapes from the Going Merry
events.description: After damaging Noko's horn and witnessing Luffy's partial memory recovery, Drim flees from the Going Merry, retreating before the crew can fully confront him or learn more about his motivations.
events.significance: Sets up continued pursuit in future episodes. Drim's escape maintains the mystery while giving the crew a clear direction to follow and hope that their memories can be restored.

events.title: The Crew Resolves to Pursue Drim
events.description: After witnessing Luffy's partial memory restoration and Drim's escape, the crew decides to pursue the mysterious boy to fully restore their memories and understand what happened to them.
events.significance: Unifies the crew around a common goal despite their amnesia. Shows their determination and trust in each other even when they don't fully remember why they should trust one another.

themes.description: The episode explores how memories define identity through the crew's struggle with amnesia. The flashbacks to Zoro's promise and Nami's trauma show that core memories and experiences shape who we are.
themes.symbolism: The horn's blue dust represents both the theft and potential restoration of identity, showing memory as something that can be lost but also recovered.

themes.description: Despite their amnesia, the crew instinctively works together and trusts one another. Their bonds transcend conscious memory, suggesting that true friendship operates on a deeper level.
themes.symbolism: The crew staying together on the ship despite not remembering why they're together represents the strength of their connection.

themes.description: Robin's analytical approach to solving the mystery demonstrates the value of logical thinking and observation, even in supernatural situations.
themes.symbolism: Robin remaining awake and aware symbolizes the importance of staying vigilant and observant.

themes.description: The flashbacks show that traumatic memories persist even through magical amnesia, exploring how deeply emotional experiences are embedded in our psyche.
themes.symbolism: The involuntary flashbacks represent how we cannot fully escape our past, even when we try to forget.

characterSpotlights.development: Robin demonstrates her crucial role as the crew's intellectual strategist. Her ability to remain calm, observe patterns, and deduce the nature of their affliction shows why she's invaluable to the crew beyond her Devil Fruit powers.

mangaDifferences.difference: The entire Ocean's Dream Arc is anime-original filler content. This episode and the entire arc (episodes 220-224) do not appear in the manga at all. The arc was based on the 'One Piece: Ocean's Dream!' PlayStation game.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the debut of the ending theme 'Mirai Kōkai' by Tackey & Tsubasa, which would continue through episode 245.
The Ocean's Dream Arc was based on the PlayStation game 'One Piece: Ocean's Dream!' released in 2003, making it one of the few anime filler arcs directly adapted from a video game.

sources.title: Ocean's Dream Arc - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The episode's next episode preview diverges from the standard format, with an amnesiac Zoro interrupting Luffy's typical declaration, adding a comedic touch that reflects the arc's memory loss theme.

The flashbacks to Zoro and Kuina, and Nami and Arlong, are recycled animation from earlier episodes (Episode 19 and the Arlong Park Arc episodes 31-44 respectively), a common cost-saving technique for filler episodes.
Chinami Nishimura, who voices Drim, also voiced other One Piece characters including Sapi and has had a long career in anime voice acting since the 1990s.

This episode aired on February 13, 2005 in Japan, falling between the end of the Davy Back Fight Arc and the beginning of the main Water 7 Arc, serving as a breather before the emotionally intense Water 7 storyline.
